alert.note: Alert for Jay (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 6:33AM EDT until March 26 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Salamonie River at Portland affecting Jay County. .A rise on this river occurred as a result of overnight rainfall. This river has a fast rise and fall rate so expect a quick turn around out of flood stage with lighter precip rates today. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salamonie River at Portland. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Lowland agricultural flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 11.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
